heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 09 November 2025 with a total accumulation of 47.89mm over 144.8 hours and falling at a rate of 24.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: On 09 November 2025, the rain lasted for 144.8 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  47.89mm accumulated and it fell at 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: The last storm was on 07 February 2026 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 3 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 0 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C) and outside temperature (down 2.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, low clouds are expected, possibly some fog or persistent clouds, and it’s dark. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
